metadata.title: CVE-2020-15648 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Using object or embed tags, it was possible to frame other websites, evenif they disallowed framing using the X-Frame-Options header. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78 and Firefox < 78.0.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
